column4: so, im setting up a amd turion 64 based laptop, which version of ubuntu is the best for my situation?
probably breezy amd64
thats what i was thinking of trying... i tried dapper 64, but had issues with not being  to get apps i wanted...
isn't dapper beta of breezy? they must have been fixed with breezy maybe
yeah... dapper is dev, breezy is stable
so you better try to use breezy and see if problems are gone :)
you can try fedora as well, it's really fine in those issues
though downloading 3 gb might make you regret :P
i dont like RH...
why? :)
fedora is different :P
I gave up around v7
sort of, but its the same idiots, and now theyve changed their business model in the crappiest way.
don't forget those idiots are employing lots of hackers which has invaluable effort in the OS you will install

well... i guess... just before fedora cam out i talked to thier cfo about it, and it was pretty clear that they like users to develop thier product, but dont want to waste any money helping users... just the big corps that buy thier systems...
well indeed they really can't support users without getting money. In past it was really doable beacuse rh users was really managable, but now it's unmanagable I think
besides RH had never evil bussiness model that anyone would disagree I think, if you got I really wonder reasons to get some idea
RH figures they can profit better from thier current model. its not too complicated.
what's wrong about profit?
nothing, profit is good, but not at the expense of users...
they didn't expense users, they are still supporting fedora, for desktop users
I for one, find fedora best desktop distro ever
using old software?
groovy... lots of people like it, but then lots of people like windows too...
